page.title: 06Health - By Mrs Wilson
page.content: The area is well served by Doctors Miller and Dudbridge. The purpose-built surgery is located at the rear of the Village Hall. Surgery times are 8 to 9.30 am daily except Fridays and Sundays. There is one evening surgery on Tuesdays 5.30 to 6.30 pm. There is also a Pharmacy incorporated. Most medicines can be supplied from there but if not they can be dispensed in Crediton and collected from Cheriton Bishop Post Office. Funds raised by villagers in 1983 purchased an Electro-cardiograph Resuscitator and Nebuliser. Patients can be attended at home by the District Nurse. Geriatric patients' residential centres are at Okehampton, Crediton and Exeter. General and maternity cases go to Exeter. Meals cooked at Tedburn St Mary are delivered twice weekly to the elderly.
